One of my favorite movies
Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
Gene Wilder  (Actor),     Jack Albertson  (Actor),     Mel Stuart  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Today's Deals, Spotlight Deals, Mother's Day Gift Ideas in Movies & TV
['Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory 40th Anniversary Edition (DVD)', 'Celebrate the 40th Anniversary of a musical fantasy for the young, and the young at heart. The mysterious candy maker extraordinaire Willy Wonka (Gene Wilder) hides a Golden Ticket inside five of his famous candy bars. The kids who find them are invited on a grand tour of the wondrous, wacky Wonka factory, and a chance for an even grander prize -- if they can resist temptation. The delightful musical score includes the hit song "The Candyman." From Roald Dahl\'s classic novel, produced by David Wolper ("Roots," "The Thorn Birds") and nominated for an Academy Award.', ']]>']

I like both versions of Willy Wonka because they each offer something a little different.  Both have basically the same great story.  Being a chocoholic myself, who wouldn't want to own a candy factory?
One of my favorite movies
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Zoltan Korda'], 'Producers': ['Alexander Korda'], 'Starring': ['John Clements', 'Ralph Richardson', 'C. Aubrey Smith'], 'Studio': ['The Criterion Collection']}
This is a great story of courage.  We will not always be understood by others.  It is most important that we understand ourselves.  In doing so, we will be better able to understand and love others.
One of my favorite movies

Although I don't like foul language at all, I am very offended by the cursing that references our Savior.  I didn't realize there was so much of it because it is edited out when watching these on network TV.  I so enjoy the action and comedy between the two characters.  Too bad it is ruined by the cursing.  I only got through Rush Hour, and that with great difficulty.
I miss the language editing for TV

Something light and enjoyable to watch.  Shaun is the smart sheep who solves the flock's problems, while helping out the sheepdog.
Just plain fun

One of my favorites

Good educational programming

Just love his "one more thing" line, and veiled ignorance which generally leaves the guilty party thinking they are safe.
My favorite detective
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Guy Norman Bee', 'Sanford Bookstaver', 'James Whitmore Jr.', 'Seith Mann', 'Martha Mitchell', 'Jon Turteltaub', 'Matt Earl Beesley', 'Steven DePaul', 'Steve Gomer', 'Christine Moore'], 'Studio': ['CBS']}
I was interested in the concept of surviving a nuclear disaster.  Unfortunately, it doesn't seem very true to life as far as the damaging effects would go, and somehow there is plenty of food for everyone to eat.  As the season moves on, it becomes more of a typical soap opera.  I lost interest about half-way through.
Interesting concept

profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user continues to favor films exploring family values, humor, and the complexities of familial relationships, alongside whimsical musical fantasy films that evoke nostalgia. They also appreciate educational programming that entertains while delivering valuable lessons. Their recent review emphasizes a strong preference for positive content, as they seek legal and mystery dramas that steer clear of negativity.

- **Humor Appreciation:** The user values light-hearted narratives rich with comedy, enjoying content that brings joy and thoughtful reflection. While maintaining a high average rating of 4.8, their recent experiences signify a refined taste in assessing authenticity and depth, particularly evident in their willingness to engage with mature themes, provided they are handled sensitively.

- **Rating Behavior:** The user is discerning in their ratings, reflecting a keen eye for quality content. Their latest perfect score indicates their appreciation for shows that avoid the negative tropes prevalent in contemporary programming.

- **Content Sensitivity:** They seek films that handle humor carefully, avoiding excessive negativity, which aligns with their thoughtful viewing approach.

- **Language & Accessibility:** The user prioritizes English-language films and values accessible features like audio descriptions and closed captions.

- **Director & Actor Affinity:** Loyalty to particular directors and actors continues, with consistent admiration for adaptations of classic narratives and engaging characters, reflecting their ongoing appreciation for intelligent dialogue and emotional depth. This also highlights their critique of content quality in recent interactions.
